IX.iii.1.F.2.f
.
Mixed Availability of a Dependent Child’s Income
It is possible that part of a dependent child’s income could be considered available to the Veteran or surviving spouse, while the remainder might be considered unavailable, and therefore, not countable.
Example
:  A child remains in the Veteran’s legal custody, but actually lives with a grandmother.  The child’s Social Security check is payable to the grandmother, but income from a trust fund is payable to the Veteran as guardian of the child.  The child’s Social Security is unavailable to the Veteran, but the trust fund income is available to the Veteran.
title: M21-1, Part IX, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section F - Dependents for Current-Law Pension Purposes
citation: Part IX, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section F
